comment.author: 23682063@N08
comment._content: Lovely, almost HDR quality. I also like the motion blur, unavoidable but aesthetic.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: I wonder whether the scaffolding we see in this pic involved the construction of the GPO tower acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemLarge.aspx?itemID=168183 (the tower was completed in late 1885...and the scaffolding removed by ca. mid March 1887 - see my notes at www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2554622065/ ), or maybe the GPO additions, which this Sydney Mail item shows were underway in mid 1898 - news.google.com/newspapers?id=ahFQAAAAIBAJ&sjid=WpUDA... ; www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/3793506599/

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Per this SMH advert, Isaac Roff, bill poster, was at 151 Clarence St (opposite the GPO) in October 1885 (bottom of column 1) - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13599725 ; By September 1889 Roff was at Goulburn St (see Richardson & Wrench advert mid way down column 2) - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article13746058 ; So there's a good possibility that this pic dates from the mid 1880s, and that it was taken prior to the removal of the scaffolding on the GPO tower, ie. before mid March 1886. T.F. Wiesener, was an 1880s-1890s Sydney watchmaker, jeweller, scientific instrument maker, etc. He had a shop at 334 George St during part of this time (see advert column 2) - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article71025090
